data.title: ESSENCE: Evaluate spatially correlated noise in interferometric images
data.name: ESSENCE
data.description: A python package for evaluating the statistical significance of the image analysis and signal detection under correlated noise in the interferometric images (e.g., ALMA, NOEMA).

evidence: README mentions binaries/installers: "For running tutorial.ipynb, please download [example data](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1h0wEPHVebVSjl803r9LnQyBTxfoU2kBY/view?usp=sharing), unzip, and place it in the same directory of the ipynb f"
“ESSENCE is a Python package for evaluating the statistical significance of image analysis and signal detection under correlated noise in interferometric images” (indicates a Python package/library).

The functions include “measuring noise autocorrelation function (ACF)… computing the noise in the spatially integrated quantities… simulating noise maps… constructing a covariance matrix… which can be used for a 2D image or 3D cube model fitting” (core scientific analysis functionality).
